A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This was just not a good movie. I have no idea why so many critics loved it\, but i've been a Star wars fan since the late 80's and I did not care for this movie at all.  

Every scene left me scratching my head from the opening scene where a lone x-wing\, piloted by Poe\, managed to blow up every single gun battery on a huge first order dreadnaught\, to the same imperial attack on a rebel base on a snow planet (this time it was salt...sigh)\, with goofy looking ATATs and awful speeders to boot.  We got to see the "rebellion" go from 400 members to about a dozen by the end of the movie.   What Rebellion?  Kylo was still his terrible whiney self.  I think he is the worst Dark side bad guy through 8 movies\, and somehow\, what little light saber choreography there was in the movie\, was just bad.  I hated the prequels but one thing that they nailed was the light saber duels.  

At this point\, I've nearly lost all interest in Disney's vision of Star Wars\, which is sad because I had such high hopes\, and while I didn't love the force awakens\, I felt it was a step in the right direction\, but after rogue one\, and now the last jedi\, I don't care if i see any more or not.
